In a statement, Eric Schmidt said: We've been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time. By clarifying our individual roles we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. In my clear opinion, Larry Page is ready to lead and I'm excited about working with both him and Sergey Brin for a long time to come. Eric Schmidt has clearly done an outstanding job leading Google for the last decade. The results speak for themselves. , DC- In a surprise shakeup, Google co-founder Larry Page is replacing Eric Schmidt as chief executive of the search giant. Starting April 4, Larry Page will take over day-to-day operations while Eric Schmidt becomes executive chairman, focusing on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership. Shortly after the announcement was posted on the company's href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/atlantic/cm_atlantic/storytext/Larry PageLarry PagereplacesEric SchmidtEric Schmidtasceoofgoogleinternetreacts6650/39756427/SIG=15887p9lt/*http://googleblog.blogspot.com/2011/01/update- from- chairman.html?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+blogspot%2FMKuf+%28Official+Google+Blog%29" title="blog"> blog, Eric Schmidt tweeted`` Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed!'' in reference to his href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/atlantic/cm_atlantic/storytext/Larry PageLarry PagereplacesEric SchmidtEric Schmidtasceoofgoogleinternetreacts6650/39756427/SIG=11vpslch7/*http://www.amazon.com/Googled-End-World-As-Know/dp/1594202354" title="much-discussed"> much-discussed
